> >
> > It means the necessar=
y robots.txt prerequisite fetch (even getting a 
> > 404) couldn't complete=
 before giving up on the URI in question.
> > 
> > Do you see preceding mat=
ching /robots.txt requests in the crawl.log

> >=
 
> > Other causes could be changing your scope such that /robots.txt URIs =

> > can't be scheduled, or setting the retries on URIs to a very small 
> =
> number. (A URi coming up for consideration, then being rescheduled to 
> =
> wait for DNS and then robots prerequisite fetches each counts as a 
> > r=
etry, so a retry count under 3 prevents this normal consider, 
> > fetch-pr=
ereqs, retry operation.)
> > 
> > - Gordon @ IA
